com.im.njams.sdk.communication

Class AbstractReplayHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.im.njams.sdk.communication.AbstractReplayHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReplayHandler

    public abstract class AbstractReplayHandler
extends Object
implements ReplayHandler
    A base implementation of the ReplayHandler interface that hides request/response handling from the actual implementation.
    Since:
    4.1.3
    Author:
    cwinkler

      • replay

        public ReplayResponse replay(ReplayRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: ReplayHandler
        Executes a replay. The implementation is responsible to set the instauctions response properly.
        Specified by:
        replay in interface ReplayHandler
        Parameters:
        request - ReplayRequest
        Returns:
        ReplayResponse

      • executeReplay

        @Deprecated
public abstract String executeReplay(String processName,
                                                 String startData,
                                                 @Deprecated
                                                 String startActivity,
                                                 @Deprecated
                                                 boolean deepTrace)
                                          throws Exception
        Deprecated. See deprecated parameters which will be removed in a future release.
        Execute a replay according to the given arguments.
        Parameters:
        processName - The name of the process that shall be replayed.
        startData - Optional input data for executing the process. May be null.
        startActivity - Deprecated. This value is not very reliable and is being removed in future. Optional name of the starter activity. May be null.
        deepTrace - Deprecated. This flag is handled internally by the SDK. Whether or not the job shall be executed with deep-trace enabled.
        Returns:
        The nJAMS log-ID of the replayed job instance needs to be returned for indicating that the according job has been started or has been scheduled for start.
        Throws:
        Exception - Any error that occurred when trying to start the replayed process.

      • testReplay

        @Deprecated
public abstract void testReplay(String processName,
                                            String startData,
                                            @Deprecated
                                            String startActivity)
                                     throws Exception
        Deprecated. See deprecated parameter which will be removed in a future release.
        Test whether or not the given process can be replayed using the given arguments. Throwing any exception indicates that the test failed while completing normal indicates test success.
        Parameters:
        processName - The name of the process that shall be replayed.
        startData - Optional input data for executing the process. May be null.
        startActivity - Deprecated. This value is not very reliable and is being removed in future. Optional name of the starter activity. May be null.
        Throws:
        Exception - Any error indicating that the test failed.
